content.body: Jake Archibald: I don't think that's weirdly different; error pages are never isolated after all
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: I don't think that's weirdly different; error pages are never isolated after all

content.body: sideshowbarker: cool thanks! I guess all specs that are intermingled with Fetch/HTML? I think it's pretty much all of them though :-)
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: cool thanks! I guess all specs that are intermingled with Fetch/HTML? I think it's pretty much all of them though :-)

content.body: annevk: yeah fair enough. I think I keep forgetting that isolation is protecting _others_ from the page, rather than protecting the page from others
content.formatted_body: annevk: yeah fair enough. I think I keep forgetting that isolation is protecting others from the page, rather than protecting the page from others

content.body: Jake Archibald: there's a bit of the latter without site isolation, but I don't think that matters for what our model should be for error pages
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: there's a bit of the latter without site isolation, but I don't think that matters for what our model should be for error pages

content.body: Jake Archibald: Googlers have been proposing changing the COEP and COOP defaults which could change some of this I suppose, depending on how far that goes
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: Googlers have been proposing changing the COEP and COOP defaults which could change some of this I suppose, depending on how far that goes

content.body: Jake Archibald: but that would change a bunch of things
